news.title: New YouTube Policy Tries to Ban ‘Implied’ Threats, ‘Malicious’ Insults
news.description: After unsuccessful efforts at policing hateful content on its platform, YouTube plans to take a more aggressive stance against content creators instigating campaigns of harassment.

news.title: Social Media Platforms Leave 95% of Reported Fake Accounts Up, Study Finds
news.description: A new study has demonstrated not only the colossal scope of inauthentic social media activity, but also that most fake accounts remain active for weeks after being reported.

news.title: Instagram to Start Warning Users Before They Post ‘Potentially Offensive’ Captions
news.description: Utilizing AI-powered tools, Instagram will begin warning users if they are about to post a caption to a photo or video in their main feed if it’s similar to captions that have been reported.

news.title: Facebook Has 4 Out of 5 of the Most Downloaded Apps of the Year
news.description: The top 5 most downloaded apps worldwide of 2019 include Facebook Messenger, Facebook, WhatsApp Messenger, and Instagram, counting only new net downloads.
